content: उपनत {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} ({%a%}) Come near, brought, arrived, approached, brought near to; <ls>Ś. 5. 19</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 102.</ls> ({%b%}) Got, obtained; अचिरोपनतां स मेदिनीं <ls>R. 8. 7</ls>, <ls n="R.">5. 52</ls>; चिंतितोपनतां <ls>K. 129</ls>; <ls>V. 3. 22</ls>; <ls>V. 2.</ls> {@--2@} Presenting itself, fallen to the lot of, befallen, occurred; कस्यात्यंतं सुखमुपनतं दुःखमेकांततो वा <ls>Me. 109</ls>; यदेवोपनतं दुःखात्सुखं तद्रसवत्तरं <ls>V. 3. 21</ls>; अनुपनतमनोरथस्य <ls n="V. 3.">22</ls>; <ls n="V.">4. 3</ls>; so सुहृदुपनतः <ls>Me. 100</ls>; <ls>Māl. 10</ls>; <ls>K. 33</ls>, <ls n="K.">132</ls>, <ls n="K.">348</ls>; सुख° that readily or without efforts presented itself <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; अकामोपनतं <ls>R. 10. 39</ls> unconsciously committed. {@--3@} Formed, brought about, effected. {@--4@} Presented to, offered, given; परलोकोपनतं जलांजलिं <ls>R. 8. 68.</ls> {@--5@} Bent down, humbled, subjected, surrendered; दंडोपनतचरितं <ls>R. 17. 81</ls>, <ls n="R.">8. 81</ls>; दंडोपनतं शत्रुं <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--6@} Dependent on (for protection). {@--7@} Approximate, near (in time or space.)
